q: " Andy Coulson has told me that the focus on him was impeding his ability to do his job and was starting to prove a distraction for the government," Mr. David Cameron said. Mr. Andy Coulson said: It's been a privilege and an honor to work for David Cameron for three and a half years. I'm extremely proud of the part I've played in helping him reach No. 10 and during the coalition's first nine months, He said in a statement. "Excellent Job' He's run the Downing Street press office in a professional, competent and good way, David Cameron told Sky. "He's done an excellent, excellent job. were in Gabrielle Giffords ' hospital room when she opened her eyes were three of her close female friends in Congress: House Democratic leader Nancy Pelosi of California, Nancy Pelosi Debbie Wasserman Schultz , D-Fla., and Barack Obama Kirsten Gillibrand , D-N.Y. The doctors couldn't believe it, Debbie Wasserman Schultz later told CNN. "It was the most incredible experience that I have ever had." Gabrielle Giffords is expected to survive, although her condition and the extent of her recovery remain in doubt.

Allen Iverson 's biggest assist to Chris Webber didn't come on a no-look pass. It came in words of encouragement to Philly's slumping newcomer. "Just get your swagger back," Chris Webber said Allen Iverson told him. Reggie Jackson 's really what I did. It helped me out. Chris Webber had his best performance in his four games with Philadelphia, scoring 24 points and grabbing 12 rebounds, and Allen Iverson added 31 points to lead the 76ers to a 98-89 win over the James Cleveland Cavaliers on Friday night

After ITV rejected Simon Cowell 's proposal for a new Saturday night ToTP-style show, negotiations with Universal are at an advanced stage for a new star-studded proposition. What Simon Cowell has achieved is history-making, says David Joseph . the deal that sent veteran forward Kevin Willis to the Nuggets, Keon Clark quietly stole the show from two of the NBA's top scorers. "We're excited about( Keon Clark )," Toronto coach Lenny Wilkens said. We're trying to work in as quickly as we can, and show him something different every day, and he's just gobbling it up. He's excited about being here and I thought that was just an incredible job he did to step in for( Baron Davis ). We went to him several times because we wanted him to know we had confidence in him. He did a great job. After helping Toronto eclipse a 20-point first-half deficit, Keon Clark watched helplessly as Allen Iverson fueled a 17-0 Philadelphia burst with 11 points, leaving the Raptors with an 89-78 deficit with 8:47 left in regulation.
